comments.body:
On Windows this fails with:

```shell
import: u'rpy2.robjects.tests'
(C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\_t_env) (root) C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\test_tmp>if errorlevel 1 exit 1 
(C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\_t_env) (root) C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\test_tmp>call "C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\test_tmp\run_test.bat" 
(C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\_t_env) (root) C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\test_tmp>python -m rpy2.tests 
C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\_t_env\lib\site-packages\rpy2\robjects\packages.py:347: UserWarning: The symbol 'quartz' is not in this R namespace/package.
  warnings.warn("The symbol '%s' is not in this R namespace/package." % name)
E....ETraceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\_t_env\lib\multiprocessing\forking.py", line 381, in main
    self = load(from_parent)
  File "C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\_t_env\lib\pickle.py", line 1384, in load
    return Unpickler(file).load()
  File "C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\_t_env\lib\pickle.py", line 864, in load
    dispatch[key](self)
  File "C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\_t_env\lib\pickle.py", line 886, in load_eof
    raise EOFError
EOFError
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\_t_env\lib\multiprocessing\forking.py", line 381, in main
    self = load(from_parent)
  File "C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\_t_env\lib\pickle.py", line 1384, in load
    return Unpickler(file).load()
  File "C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\_t_env\lib\pickle.py", line 864, in load
    dispatch[key](self)
  File "C:\bld\rpy2_1494244814571\_t_env\lib\pickle.py", line 886, in load_eof
    raise EOFError
EOFError
E...........
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +68,72 @@    - rpy2.robjects.tests
  commands:
    - python -m rpy2.tests  # [not win]

about:
